# Aufgabe

Importieren Sie den Datensatz `mariokart` in R.
Berechnen Sie den mittleren Verkaufspreis (`total_pr`) für Spiele, die sowohl neu sind *als auch* über Lenkräder (`wheels`) verfügen.

Hinweise:

- Runden Sie auf 1 Dezimalstelle.



</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>

# Lösung

Pakete starten:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_36072225accaac805681d7a442813726'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(easystats)
```
:::



Daten importieren:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_593d63d9d2063c40030d403f3de29480'}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_url <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/openintro/mariokart.csv"
d <- data_read(d_url)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_49bbab9be004ca42658fb58c993c50e3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
solution <-
d  %>% 
  filter(cond == "new" & wheels > 0) %>% 
  summarise(pr_corr = cor(total_pr, start_pr))

solution
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
    pr_corr
1 0.4315485
```


:::
:::




Alternativ kann man (komfortabel) die Korrelation z.B. so berechnen:


::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_e103bcf19988b1625285afb8b5664cf9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
d %>% 
  select(start_pr, total_pr, cond, wheels) %>% 
  filter(cond == "new" & wheels > 0) %>% 
  correlation()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# Correlation Matrix (pearson-method)

Parameter1 | Parameter2 |    r |        95% CI | t(53) |         p
------------------------------------------------------------------
start_pr   |   total_pr | 0.43 | [ 0.19, 0.63] |  3.48 | 0.002**  
start_pr   |     wheels | 0.12 | [-0.15, 0.37] |  0.86 | 0.393    
total_pr   |     wheels | 0.77 | [ 0.64, 0.86] |  8.82 | < .001***

p-value adjustment method: Holm (1979)
Observations: 55
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='mariokart-korr3_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_97bbe9b60e99c340473ec99053303483'}

:::


**Lösung:** 0.4.
